name: vault_matters_holds_accounts_create
description: Adds an account to a hold. Accounts can be added only to a hold that does not have an organizational unit set. If you try to add an account to an organizational unit-based hold, an error is returned.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

HeldAccount.description: An account covered by a hold. This structure is immutable. It can be an individual account or a Google Group, depending on the service. To work with Vault resources, the account must have the [required Vault privileges] (https://support.google.com/vault/answer/2799699) and access to the matter. To access a matter, the account must have created the matter, have the matter shared with them, or have the **View All Matters** privilege.

accountId.description: The account ID, as provided by the [Admin SDK](https://developers.google.com/admin-sdk/).

email.description: The primary email address of the account. If used as an input, this takes precedence over **accountId**.

firstName.description: Output only. The first name of the account holder.

holdTime.description: Output only. When the account was put on hold.

lastName.description: Output only. The last name of the account holder.

$block: An account covered by a hold. This structure is immutable. It can be an individual account or a Google Group, depending on the service. To work with Vault resources, the account must have the [required Vault privileges] (https://support.google.com/vault/answer/2799699) and access to the matter. To access a matter, the account must have created the matter, have the matter shared with them, or have the **View All Matters** privilege.

$ul: **accountId**: The account ID, as provided by the [Admin SDK](https://developers.google.com/admin-sdk/).
**email**: The primary email address of the account. If used as an input, this takes precedence over **accountId**.
**firstName**: Output only. The first name of the account holder.
**holdTime**: Output only. When the account was put on hold.
**lastName**: Output only. The last name of the account holder.
